H3.text: who are the senators of new jersey now. Bob Menendez

A4.text: When the state's other U.S. Senator, Frank Lautenberg, announced his planned retirement, Menendez again decided not to run, with the Democratic nomination for the 2000 race going to Goldman Sachs CEO Jon Corzine, who won the general election.

A5.text: When incumbent U.S. Senator Bill Bradley decided to retire in August 1995, Menendez made known his intention to run in the 1996 election for the seat, but eventually dropped out of the race and endorsed Robert Torricelli, the Democrat representing New Jersey's 9th congressional district.

A6.text: Senator Robert Menendez Archived January 27, 2024, at the Wayback Machine official U.S. Senate website
